Key Match Events: Virat Kohli's 'fake fielding' incident went unnoticed by on-field umpires Marais Erasmus and Chris Brown
Bangladesh were 17 runs ahead on DLS when play resumed following a rain break at the end of the seventh over
Rohit Sharma joined in the discussion with Shakib Al Hasan and the match officials about play resuming
Post-Match Reflections: Nurul Hasan mentioned the 'fake fielding' incident while talking to reporters after the game
Jalal Yunus, BCB cricket operations chairman, said the incident was brought to the umpires' attention but not reviewed
Shakib Al Hasan spoke extensively to Erasmus during and after the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cricket's Law 41.5 prohibits deliberate distraction, deception, or obstruction of the batter, and can result in a five-run penalty
The replay could be interpreted as an attempt at deception from Kohli, given that Arshdeep's throw from the deep passed by his right hand at the same moment that he motioned a relay throw
